datafield.subfield: Software to preprocess the Muon and Electron datasets for the two-lepton/four-lepton analysis example
Use this with the following datasets:
Software to produce the intermediate data files, derived from the primary datasets, for a simple analysis on Z decays to two leptons and the ZZ decays to four leptons.
CMSSW_4_2_8 software with the CMS open data VM environment
Only muon and electron collections are kept. Processing the full primary datasets took 220 hours.

The software produces the physics object in PAT candidate format. Only muon and electron PAT candidate collections are stored. No further selection, apart accepting only the validated runs, is applied.
Only the list of validated runs have been accepted:
Use this with the following datasets:
Example code for a simple analysis on Z decays to two leptons and the ZZ decays to four leptons.
CMSSW_4_2_8 software with the CMS open data VM environment
Processing the preprocessed datasets takes several hours.

\subsection{Analysis description} The Z decay to two leptons and the ZZ decay to four leptons are considered. \\* An event selection applied to distinguish the signal from the background. \\* In the Z analysis, at least two leptons with opposite charge are required, with invariant mass $\rm m_{ll}$ between 12 GeV and 120 GeV. The pair with the invariant mass closest to the Z boson mass is select as the Z candidate. \\* In the ZZ analysis, two Z candidates are required, in both cases with two leptons with opposite charge. \\* The first candidate is required to have higher lepton momentum: 20 GeV the first lepton and 10 GeV the second lepton. \\*The invariant mass in the range 40 GeV to 120 GeV. The second candidate is required to have an invariant mass higher then 4 GeV. The first candidate is the one with the invariant mass closest to the Z boson mass. \\* \\* The selection of leptons is as follows for both analysis: \subsubsection{Selection of electrons} \label{subsubsec:electrons} The selection criteria for PAT electron candidates are: \begin{itemize} \item $p_T > 7$ GeV and $|\eta| \item Distance between the electron z-vertex and the interaction z-vertex $ \item Transverse impact parameter w.r.t. the beam spot $ \item Symmetrized impact parameter w.r.t. the beam sport $ \item Photon conversion rejection: number of lost hits in the tracker $ \item Electron identification: eIDLoose; \\ \item Electron Isolation depends on the $\eta$ region, regions with 1.44 $ \\ If $\eta$ $ 0.09$; \ $electron.dr03EcalRecHitSumEt() / electron.pt() > 0.07$; \ and $electron.dr03HcalTowerSumEt() / electron.pt() > 0.10$. \ If $\eta$ $>$ 1.57: $electron.dr03TkSumPt() / electron.pt() > 0.04$; \ $electron.dr03EcalRecHitSumEt() / electron.pt() > 0.05$; \ and $electron.dr03HcalTowerSumEt() / electron.pt() > 0.025$. \ Each component is computed from Isodeposits in a cone of 0.3 around the electron direction. \end{itemize} \subsubsection{Selection of muons} \label{subsubsec:muons} The selection criteria for PAT muon candidates are:\ \begin{itemize} \item $p_T > 5$ GeV and $|\eta| \item Distance between the muon z-vertex and the interaction z-vertex $ \item Is a GlobalMuon and TrackerMuon; \\ \item Number of valid hits in the inner tracker $> 10$;\ \item $\chi^2/ndof <10 $ for the global muon fit;\ \item Transverse impact parameter w.r.t. the beam spot $< 0.02$ cm;\ \item Symmetrized impact parameter w.r.t. the beam sport $< 4$ cm; \ \item Relative Muon Isolation ($RMI$) $<0.15$, with \ $$RMI = \frac{(ChargedHadronIso+NeutralHadronIso+PhotonIso)}{p_T(\mu)}$$ \ \\* Each component is computed from Isodeposits in a cone of 0.3 around the muon direction. \end{itemize}
The input files contain only the validated runs. For user validation of the analysis step, compare the result to the expected output file.
The expected output is a histogram file
